An intern encrypted the secret flag with RSA, but accidentally leaked half the private key digits. Can you recover the flag from this partial key exposure?2405112564432284244404558295718353959063957727567710390834297194203778944169211310042612188753810100298614035740229278444329403488153595807783276580006394

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6316736945221229147416313999858637463672775190479835502776638335539203210100131322200774837932895221856661361390885699075098163031790832442434605227649949, e=5340686744152607926452544142194393573903328280157608458838906755941238637445041808706801225040180107323391554844058134082438095945210793562706592974763331, partial_p=13586249741056198003

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{k0w8jorz}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2405112564432284244404558295718353959063957727567710390834297194203778944169211310042612188753810100298614035740229278444329403488153595807783276580006394
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6316736945221229147416313999858637463672775190479835502776638335539203210100131322200774837932895221856661361390885699075098163031790832442434605227649949, e=5340686744152607926452544142194393573903328280157608458838906755941238637445041808706801225040180107323391554844058134082438095945210793562706592974763331, partial_p=13586249741056198003
extra_info: p=85282271826980702647581725643604969498051941994693001595477296834257888134691, q=74068582014753583998078106890739684131542154618702445173297303007772867167039, Ï†(n)=6316736945221229147416313999858637463672775190479835502776638335539203210099971971346933103646249562024127016737256104978484767585022057842592574472348220
